```java
public class FileConverter {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter the filename for the first file");
        String filename = keyboard.nextLine();
        File file = new File(filename);
        Scanner inputFile = null;
        PrintWriter outputFile = null;
        
        try {
            inputFile = new Scanner(file);
            outputFile = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter("output.txt"));
            
            while (inputFile.hasNext()) {
                String fileinfo = inputFile.nextLine();
                String uppercaseinfo = fileinfo.toUpperCase();
                outputFile.write(uppercaseinfo);
            }
        } catch (IOException e) {
            System.out.println("An error occurred while reading or writing the file.");
            e.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (inputFile != null) {
                inputFile.close();
            }
            if (outputFile != null) {
                outputFile.close();
            }
        }
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: 
In this code, we use the PrintWriter.write method to write the uppercase information to the second file. We first create a Scanner object to read the first file and a PrintWriter object to write to the second file. Inside the while loop, we read each line from the first file, convert it to uppercase, and then use the PrintWriter.write method to write it to the second file. Finally, we close both the input and output files in the finally block to ensure proper resource management and handle any exceptions that may occur during the process.
